summary: Feature request to add native workflow queueing/buffering capability similar to executeChild, allowing workflows to queue subsequent executions without creating schedules or clients. Current workaround uses schedules with BUFFER_ONE policy but has limitations like inability to pass arguments.
userImpact: Users cannot efficiently queue workflows from within a workflow without creating schedules and clients, requiring boilerplate code to implement buffering patterns.
proposedFix: Add native workflow queueing capability similar to executeChild that allows workflows to queue subsequent executions from within the workflow without requiring schedule creation or client instantiation.
workaround: Use entity workflow pattern with signals and continueAsNew to buffer requests in-memory, maintaining a queue that processes items sequentially while managing history growth.
keyQuote: The ability to queue a workflow after the completion of a currently running workflow, similar to the BUFFER_ONE schedule overlap policy.
